body_html:
It's now supported in TF. You should be able to use from the nightly build. (#17367)
Although we're trying to add more autotune logic s.t. TF would automatically choose between regular RNN and persistent RNN based on history. But without that you should still be able to use tensor_op.
body_text:
It's now supported in TF. You should be able to use from the nightly build. (#17367)
Although we're trying to add more autotune logic s.t. TF would automatically choose between regular RNN and persistent RNN based on history. But without that you should still be able to use tensor_op.
body:
It's now supported in TF. You should be able to use from the nightly build. (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/17367)
Although we're trying to add more autotune logic s.t. TF would automatically choose between regular RNN and persistent RNN based on history. But without that you should still be able to use tensor_op.
